questionText: Who among the following eminent Assamese attended the First Round Table Conference held in London in 1930?
Why is the Prime Minister in India not directly elected by the people? Choose the most appropriate answer and give reasons for your choice:
options: In a Parliamentary democracy only the leader of the majority party in the Lok Sabha can become the Prime Minister.
Lok Sabha can remove the Prime Minister and the Council of Ministers even before the expiry of their term.
Since the Prime Minister is appointed by the President there is no need for it.
Direct election of the Prime Minister will involve lot of expenditure on election.

questionText: Which of the following is the correct statement regarding 'carbon footprint' in the context of global warming?
options: It is a measure of greenhouse gas emissions by vehicles or any industrial product.
It is a unit under the Kyoto Protocol for reduction in emission of greenhouse gases.
It is an administrative measure to control pollution by providing incentive.

questionText: 'Thang ta', a martial art form is associated with which state of India?

options: Comptroller and Auditor General of India

questionText: Any such transaction, in which property is transferred in the name of one person and payment is made by another person, is called __________?
The "Chipko Movement" in India is known for:
options: Advocating for the rights of forest-dwelling tribal communities
Promoting the commercialization of forest resources
Encouraging the construction of large-scale dams in forested areas

statements: BRICS is an acronym representing Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa. The group was informally established in 2006 and formalised in 2009.
The inaugural summit of BRICS took place in Yekaterinburg, Russia.
BRICS has since included additional members, including Iran, Egypt, Ethiopia and UAE, reflecting its growing prominence in global affairs.
Recently, Indonesia has officially become a full member of the BRICS group.
statementInstructions: How many of the statements given above is/are correct?
